required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial Comparing the Pharmacokinetic Properties of Fast-acting Insulin Aspart Between Children, Adolescents and Adults With Type 1 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial Comparing the Pharmacokinetic Properties of Fast-acting Insulin Aspart Between Children, Adolescents and Adults With Type 1 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: The study is done to compare how faster aspart is taken up, broken down and removed from the body between different age groups (children [6-11 years], adolescents [12-17 years] and adults [18-64 years]) who have diabetes. The blood sugar (glucose) lowering effect of faster aspart will also be investigated after consuming a meal replacement drink. The effects of faster aspart will be compared to the effects of NovoRapid®.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Sponsor staff involved in the clinical trial is masked according to company standard procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC(IAsp),0-12h, area under the serum insulin aspart concentration-time curve from 0 to 12 hours
primary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUCIAsp,0-15min, area under the serum insulin aspart concentration-time curve 0 to 15 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUCIAsp,0-30min, area under the serum insulin aspart concentration-time curve from 0 to 30 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUCIAsp,0-1hr, area under the serum insulin aspart concentration-time curve from 0 to 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUCIAsp,0-1½hr, area under the serum insulin aspart concentration-time curve from 0 to 1½ hour
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUCIAsp,0-2hr, area under the serum insulin aspart concentration-time curve from 0 to 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax,IAsp, maximum observed serum insulin aspart concentration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: tmax,IAsp, time to maximum observed serum insulin aspart concentration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Onset of appearanceIAsp, time from trial product administration until the first time serum insulinaspart concentration greater than or equal to Lower Limit Of Quantitation (LLOQ)
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of exposureIAsp, time from trial product administration until the first time serum insulin aspart concentration is equal to LLOQ in the terminal part of the curve
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to 50% Cmax, IAsp, the first time point where the insulin aspart concentration equals 50% of Cmax,IAsp
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to late 50% Cmax,IAsp, the last time point where the insulin aspart concentration equals 50% of Cmax,IAsp
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on insulin aspart measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in plasma glucose concentration from 0-1 hour after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on glucose concentration measured in plasma.

secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on glucose concentration measured in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma glucose concentration 1 hour after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on glucose concentration measured in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma glucose concentration 2 hours after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on glucose concentration measured in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum plasma glucose excursion after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on glucose concentration measured in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum plasma glucose concentration after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on glucose concentration measured in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum plasma glucose concentration after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on glucose concentration measured in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum plasma glucose concentration after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated based on glucose concentration measured in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening day 1 up to the study completion day 68
secondary_outcome.description: Count of events

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of hypoglycaemic episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening day 1 up to the study completion day 68
secondary_outcome.description: Count of hypoglycaemic episodes

arm_group.arm_group_label: Faster aspart followed by insulin aspart (NovoRapid®)
arm_group.description: Participants will receive single dose of fast-acting insulin aspart followed by single dose of NovoRapid® on two separate dosing visits. The dosing visits will be separated by a wash-out period of 3-22 days.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Insulin aspart (NovoRapid®) followed by faster aspart
arm_group.description: Participants will receive single dose of NovoRapid® followed by single dose of fast-acting insulin aspart on two separate dosing visits. The dosing visits will be separated by a wash-out period of 3-22 days.

intervention.description: An injection of fast-acting insulin aspart 0.2 U/kg body weight under the skin just prior to a standard meal.
intervention.arm_group_label: Faster aspart followed by insulin aspart (NovoRapid®)
Insulin aspart (NovoRapid®) followed by faster aspart

intervention.description: An injection of insulin aspart (NovoRapid®) 0.2 U/kg body weight under the skin just prior to a standard meal.
intervention.arm_group_label: Faster aspart followed by insulin aspart (NovoRapid®)
Insulin aspart (NovoRapid®) followed by faster aspart

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female aged 6-64 years (both inclusive) at the time of signing informed consent
- Diagnosed with type 1 diabetes greater than or equal to 12 months prior to the day of screening
- Body mass index for children and adolescents (male and female) between the 3rd and 97th BMI percentile and for adults less than or equal to 28.0 kg/sqm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject who has donated any blood or plasma in the past month or more than 500 mL within 3 months prior to screening
- Smoker (defined as a subject who is smoking at least one cigarette, cigar or pipe daily)
- Not able or willing to refrain from smoking and use of nicotine substitute products during the inpatient period

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination

patient_data.ipd_description: According to the Novo Nordisk disclosure commitment on novonordisk-trials.com
